claims.object: device involving creating a separatrix-bounded magnetic topology using special magnetic coils
diverting particles and heat diffusing outward from the main plasma

surface_layer.definition: A device that uses magnetic fields to divert particles and heat away from the main plasma in a fusion reactor.

deep_layer.mechanism: Special magnetic coils create a separatrix-bounded magnetic topology. Particles and heat diffusing outward from the main plasma are diverted and follow the 'open' magnetic field lines to strike dedicated plasma-facing components.
deep_layer.origin: Developed for use in fusion reactors to manage heat and particle flux.
